page.title: 01THE ISLE OF CANNA
page.content: The island of Canna is the most westerly of the small isles of the inner Hebrides. It is almost 5 miles long and about 1 mile wide. The island of Sanday, which is connected to to Canna by a footbridge, is nearly 2 miles long and up to 0.75 miles wide. The 2 islands are hereafter referred to collectively as Canna. The population of Canna is currently 17 people. The majority of those employed work for the National Trust for Scotland who were given the island in 1981 by the previous owner Dr John Lorne Campbell. Canna has been treated as a bird sanctuary since 1938. The whole island, although farmed, is designated a Nature Conservancy Council Site of Special Scientific Interest for biological and geological reasons.
